element.name: dc:title
element.label: Title
element.description: A name given to the resource. Typically, Title will be a name by which the resource is formally known.

element.name: dc:creator
element.label: Creator
element.description: An entity primarily responsible for making the content of the resource.
element.example: Examples of Creator include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Creator should be used to indicate the entity.

element.name: dc:subject
element.label: Subject and Keywords
element.description: A topic of the content of the resource. Typically, Subject will be expressed as keywords, key phrases, or classification codes that describe a topic of the resource.
element.example: Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary or formal classification scheme.

element.name: dc:description
element.label: Description
element.description: An account of the content of the resource.
element.example: Examples of Description include, but are not limited to, an abstract, table of contents, reference to a graphical representation of content, or free-text account of the content.

element.name: dc:publisher
element.label: Publisher
element.description: An entity responsible for making the resource available.
element.example: Examples of Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

element.name: dc:contributor
element.label: Contributor
element.description: An entity responsible for making contributions to the content of the resource.
element.example: Examples of Contributor include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Contributor should be used to indicate the entity.

element.name: dc:date
element.label: Date
element.description: A date of an event in the lifecycle of the resource. Typically, Date will be associated with the creation or availability of the resource.
element.example: Recommended best practice for encoding the date value is defined in a profile of ISO 8601 and includes (among others) dates of the form YYYY-MM-DD.

element.name: dc:type
element.label: Resource Type
element.description: The nature or genre of the content of the resource. Type includes terms describing general categories, functions, genres, or aggregation levels for content.
element.example: Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the DCMI Type Vocabulary). To describe the physical or digital manifestation of the resource, use the Format element.

element.name: dc:format
element.label: Format
element.description: The physical or digital manifestation of the resource. Typically, Format will include the media-type or dimensions of the resource. Format may be used to identify the software, hardware, or other equipment needed to display or operate the resource.
element.example: Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the list of Internet Media Types defining computer media formats).

element.name: dc:identifier
element.label: Resource Identifier
element.description: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.
element.example: Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system. Formal identification systems include but are not limited to the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) (including the Uniform Resource Locator (URL)), the Digital Object Identifier (DOI), and the International Standard Book Number (ISBN).

element.name: dc:source
element.label: Source
element.description: A Reference to a resource from which the present resource is derived. The present resource may be derived from the Source resource in whole or in part.
element.example: Recommended best practice is to identify the referenced resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

element.name: dc:language
element.label: Language
element.description: A language of the intellectual content of the resource. Recommended best practice is to use RFC 3066, which, in conjunction with ISO 639, defines two- and three-letter primary language tags with optional subtags.
element.example: Examples include "en" or "eng" for English, "akk" for Akkadian, and "en-GB" for English used in the United Kingdom.

element.name: dc:relation
element.label: Relation
element.description: A reference to a related resource.
element.example: Recommended best practice is to identify the referenced resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

element.name: dc:coverage
element.label: Coverage
element.description: The extent or scope of the content of the resource. Typically, Coverage will include spatial location (a place name or geographic coordinates), temporal period (a period label, date, or date range), or jurisdiction (such as a named administrative entity).
element.example: For example: "North 90, South -90, East 180, West -180. Global". Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the Thesaurus of Geographic Names [TGN]) and to use, where appropriate, named places or time periods in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.

element.name: dc:rights
element.label: Rights Management
element.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource.
element.example: Typically, Rights will contain a rights management statement for the resource, or reference a service providing such information. Rights information often encompasses Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), Copyright, and various Property Rights. If the Rights element is absent, no assumptions may be made about any rights held in or over the resource.

element.name: dct:modified
element.label: Date Modified
element.description: Data metadata was modified

element.name: dct:abstract
element.label: Abstract
element.description: A summary of the content of the resource.

element.name: dct:spatial
element.label: Spatial
element.description: Spatial characteristics of the intellectual content of the resource.

element.name: dct:audience
element.label: Audience
element.description: A class of entity for whom the resource is intended or useful.

element.name: dct:accrualMethod
element.label: Accrual Method
element.description: The method by which items are added to a collection.

element.name: dct:accrualPeriodicity
element.label: Accrual Periodicity
element.description: The frequency with which items are added to a collection.

element.name: dct:accrualPolicy
element.label: Accrual Policy
element.description: The policy governing the addition of items to a collection.

element.name: dct:instructionalMethod
element.label: Instructional Method
element.description: A process, used to engender knowledge, attitudes and skills, that the resource is designed to support.

element.name: dct:provenance
element.label: Provenance
element.description: A statement of any changes in ownership and custody of the resource since its creation that are significant for its authenticity, integrity and interpretation.

element.name: dct:rightsHolder
element.label: Rights Holder
element.description: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.

strings.xml_dublin-core: Save this metadata as a Dublin Core XML file
strings.xml_dublin-coreTooai_dc: Save this metadata as an OAI Dublin Core XML file

element.name: mcp:MD_Metadata
element.label: Metadata (MCP)
element.description: root entity which defines metadata about a resource or resources

element.name: mcp:revisionDate
element.label: Revision Date
element.description: Date the metadata was last revised (Australian Marine Community Profile extension to ISO19115/19139)

element.name: mcp:MD_DataIdentification
element.label: Data identification (MCP)
element.description: information required to identify an Australian Marine Community Profile dataset (Australian Marine Community Profile extension to ISO19115/19139)

element.name: mcp:samplingFrequency
element.label: Sampling Frequency
element.description: To describe the frequency of the sampled resource (Australian Marine Community Profile extension to ISO19115/19139)

element.name: mcp:EX_TemporalExtent
element.label: Temporal Extent (MCP)
element.description: time period covered by the content of the dataset

element.name: mcp:beginTime
element.label: Begin Time
element.description: start of time period covered by the dataset (deprecated - use gml: elements in the extent element instead)

element.name: mcp:endTime
element.label: End Time
element.description: end of time period covered by the dataset (deprecated - use gml: elements in the extent element instead)

element.name: mcp:currency
element.label: Temporal Currency
element.description: Describes the temporal currency of the resource (Australian Marine Community Profile extension to ISO19115/19139)

element.name: mcp:temporalAggregation
element.label: Temporal Aggregation
element.description: Describes the temporal aggregation of the resource (Australian Marine Community Profile extension to ISO19115/19139)

element.name: mcp:dataParameters
element.label: Data Parameters
element.description: Describes the Parameters or variables included in dataset

element.name: mcp:dataParameter
element.label: Data Parameter Info
element.description: Details about a specific Parameter, including he various names and labels used for that parameter; the unit-of-measurement (UOM) used; the minimum and maximum values measured in the dataset, and a description of the parameter the definitions of the parameters information

element.name: mcp:parameterName
element.label: Parameter Name
element.description: Specific Parameter's name or label. Details include whether this is a shortname, longname, code or "other". It also the details of a vocabulary list (if one is known) that the label or name belongs to, and the label's definition

element.name: mcp:name
element.label: Name
element.description: Name of Parameter

element.name: mcp:name
element.label: Name
element.description: Name of Unit Of Measure (UOM)

element.name: mcp:type
element.label: Type
element.description: Type of Name - typically: long, short, code or other

element.name: mcp:usedInDataset
element.label: Used in dataset?
element.description: Specific Parameter or UOM name being discussed in this element

element.name: mcp:vocabularyListURL
element.label: Names VocabularyList URL
element.description: Version of the parameter vocabulary list that includes and defines this name; Only use this, if the name actually is defined in a parameter or "UOM" vocabulary list that is available from the web

element.name: mcp:vocabularyListVersion
element.label: Names VocabularyList Version
element.description: Version of the parameter vocabulary list that includes and defines this name;

element.name: mcp:vocabularyListAuthority
element.label: Names VocabularyList Authority
element.description: Authority usually means a body or organisation regulating a vocabulary list. Use this field if the shortname or longname or param-code are defined in a parameter or "UOM" vocabulary list that is defined, maintained or regulated by a particular body or organisation

element.name: mcp:parameterMinimumValue
element.label: Min.Value in dataset
element.description: Minimum value measured - for this parameter, within this dataset

element.name: mcp:parameterMaximumValue
element.label: Max.Value in dataset
element.description: Maximum value measured - for this parameter, within this dataset

element.name: mcp:parameterDescription
element.label: Parameter Description
element.description: Description of Param

element.name: mcp:localDefinition
element.label: Local definition
element.description: Local definition of Param or UOM; Used where an external vocabulary hasn't been used, or where an external vocab's definition is insufficient

description.p: Includes names and labels for the UOM, as well as details of vocabulary Lists that include the label, and defnitions.
This can be a standard UOM such as SI units; or might be a relative/local measurement. An example of the latter is:

li.ul: PARAM name: field-based surface turbidity measure;
PARAM defn: visibility test taken at 1,3 aand 5 feet below surface;
PARAM UOM: possible value range is 10-0, 0 means clear;

description.p: Test involves visible detection of an item at 1, 3, and 5 feet, under the water surface. The item placed under the water is a plate inscribed with a shape enclosing 4 dots; and that shape is of varying sizes.

element.name: mcp:MD_Commons
element.label: Commons License
element.description: Commons Constraints on metadata or resource eg. creative commons

element.name: mcp:MD_CreativeCommons
element.label: Creative Commons License (deprecated)
element.description: Creative Commons License (deprecated)

element.name: mcp:MD_DataCommons
element.label: Data Commons License (deprecated)
element.description: Data Commons License (deprecated)

element.name: mcp:attributionConstraints
element.label: Attribution Constraints
element.description: Describes how and when the resource should be attributed as well as who the resource should be attributed to. For example: Jones, C, 3D Mining Data, International Journal of Mining, University Press, must be cited whenever this data is referred to in a paper.

element.name: mcp:derivativeConstraints
element.label: Derivative Constraints
element.description: Describes the constraints on products that may be derived from this resource.

element.name: mcp:commercialUseConstraints
element.label: Commercial Use Constraints
element.description: Describes what the constraints are if you want to make use of this resource commercially.

element.name: mcp:collectiveWorksConstraints
element.label: Collective Work Constraints
element.description: Describes what the constraints are if you wish to include this resource in a collective work.

element.name: mcp:otherConstraints
element.label: Other Constraints
element.description: Describes any constraints on using this resource that are not captured by the other constraint fields.

element.name: mcp:commonsType
element.label: Commons License
element.description: Describes the type of commons license that describes the conditions of usage. Can be applied to metadata or resource.

element.name: mcp:taxonomicElement
element.label: Taxonomic Element
element.description: Taxonomic Element is a container for the Taxonomic coverage of the resource.

element.name: mcp:EX_TaxonomicCoverage
element.label: Taxonomic Coverage
element.description: Taxonomic Coverage of the resource.

element.name: mcp:taxonConcepts
element.label: Link to Taxonomic Information
element.description: This is a link to an xml description of a species name (or higher level ranks) from one or more classification systems that is or is used in the resource. Supported at present are links to the Australian Plant Census/Database (APC/APD) and the Australian Fauna Database (AFD).

element.name: mcp:presentationLink
element.label: HTML presentation of Taxonomic Information
element.description: This is a link to an html description of a species name (or higher level ranks) from one or more classification systems that is or is used in the resource. Supported at present are links to the Australian Plant Census/Database (APC/APD) and the Australian Fauna Database (AFD).

element.name: mcp:EX_Extent
element.label: Extent
element.description: Information about spatial, vertical, temporal and taxonomic extent

element.name: mcp:extent
element.label: Extent
element.description: Information about spatial, vertical, temporal and taxonomic extent

element.name: mcp:contactInfo
element.label: Contact Information
element.description: Address of the responsible party

element.name: mcp:party
element.label: Responsible party
element.description: Details and contact information for a responsible party (Organisation or individual)

element.name: mcp:individual
element.label: Responsible individual
element.description: Details and contact information for a responsible individual within an organisation

element.name: mcp:CI_Individual
element.label: Responsible individual
element.description: Details and contact information for a responsible individual (possibly within an organisation)

element.name: mcp:CI_Organisation
element.label: Responsible organisation
element.description: Details and contact information for a responsible organisation (may contain details of responsible individuals)

element.name: mcp:role
element.label: Role
element.description: Function performed by the responsible party

element.name: mcp:metadataContactInfo
element.label: Metadata Contact
element.description: Contact information for those parties who have a role in producing. maintaining and looking after the metadata.

element.name: mcp:resourceContactInfo
element.label: Resource Contact
element.description: Contact information for those parties who have a role in producing. maintaining and looking after the resource.

element.name: mcp:responsibleParty
element.label: Responsible Party
element.description: Contact information for those parties who have been cited as responsible for the resource.

element.name: mcp:CI_Responsibility
element.label: Responsibility
element.description: Contact information for those parties who have been cited as responsible for the resource.

element.name: mcp:CI_Citation
element.label: Citation
element.description: Citation information.

element.name: mcp:positionName
element.label: Position Name
element.description: Position of the individual within the organisation

element.name: mcp:name
element.label: Name
element.description: Organisation Name

element.name: mcp:name
element.label: Name
element.description: Individual Name

entry.label: Document

entry.label: Data Repository

entry.label: Project

entry.label: Observed

entry.label: Derived

entry.label: Publication

entry.label: Data Object
entry.description: Information applies to data objects

entry.label: Creation
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was brought into existence

entry.label: Publication
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was issued

entry.label: Revision
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and improved or amended

entry.label: Unknown
entry.description: It is unknown what the date identifies

entry.label: Resource provider
entry.description: Party that supplies the resource

entry.label: Custodian
entry.description: Party that accepts accountability and responsability for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource

entry.label: Owner
entry.description: Party that owns the resource

entry.label: User
entry.description: Party who uses the resource

entry.label: Distributor

entry.label: Originator
entry.description: Party who created the resource

entry.label: Point of contact
entry.description: Party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource

entry.label: Principal investigator
entry.description: Key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research

entry.label: Processor
entry.description: Party wha has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified

entry.label: Publisher
entry.description: Party who published the resource

entry.label: Author
entry.description: Party who authored the resource

entry.label: Co-investigator
entry.description: One of the key parties responsible for gathering information and conducting research

entry.label: Research assistant
entry.description: Party who helped gather information and conduct research

entry.label: Licensor
entry.description: Party responsible for licensing

entry.label: IP Owner
entry.description: Party who owns the intellectual property

entry.label: Metadata Contact
entry.description: party who can be contacted about the metadata

entry.label: Moral Rights Owner
entry.description: Party who owns the moral rights

entry.label: Discipline
entry.description: Keyword identifies a branch of instruction or specialized learning

entry.label: Place
entry.description: Keyword identifies a location

entry.label: Stratum
entry.description: Keyword identifies the layer(s) of any deposited substance

entry.label: Temporal
entry.description: Keyword identifies a time period related to the dataset

entry.label: Theme
entry.description: Keyword identifies a particular subject or topic

entry.label: Taxon
entry.description: Keyword identifies a taxonomy

entry.label: Equipment
entry.description: Keyword identifies equipment used in data collection.

entry.label: Survey
entry.description: Keyword identifies a survey/voyage.

entry.label: Project
entry.description: Keyword identifies a project.

entry.label: Data Source
entry.description: Keyword identifies data source eg. model, or aggregated/derived data.

entry.label: Continual
entry.description: Data is repeatedly and frequently updated

entry.label: Daily
entry.description: Data is updated each day

entry.label: Weekly
entry.description: Data is updated on a weekly basis

entry.label: Fortnightly
entry.description: Data is updated every two weeks

entry.label: Monthly
entry.description: Data is updated each month

entry.label: Quarterly
entry.description: Data is updated every three months

entry.label: Biannually
entry.description: Data is updated twice each year

entry.label: Annually
entry.description: Data is updated every year

entry.label: As needed
entry.description: Data is updated as deemed necessary

entry.label: Irregular
entry.description: Data is updated in intervals that are uneven in duration

entry.label: Not planned
entry.description: There are no plans to update the data

entry.label: Unknown
entry.description: Frequency of maintenance for the data is not known

entry.label: Hourly
entry.description: Data is updated hourly

entry.label: Most Recent
entry.description: Resource currency is most recent

entry.label: Historical
entry.description: Resource currency is historical

entry.label: Predicted
entry.description: Resource currency is predicted

entry.label: Unknown
entry.description: Resource currency is unknown

entry.label: Day
entry.description: Aggregation unit is day

entry.label: Multi-day
entry.description: Aggregation unit is multi-day

entry.label: Week
entry.description: Aggregation unit is week

entry.label: Multi-week
entry.description: Aggregation unit is multi-week

entry.label: Year
entry.description: Aggregation unit is year

entry.label: Multi-year
entry.description: Aggregation unit is multi-year

entry.label: None
entry.description: Aggregation unit is none

entry.label: Short Name
entry.description: The short name by which the parameter or unit is known

entry.label: Long Name
entry.description: The long name by which the parameter or unit is known

entry.label: Code
entry.description: The code by which the parameter or unit is known

entry.label: Other
entry.description: The parameter or unit is known by this name for some other reason

element.name: gmd:MD_ScopeCode
element.label: Scope code
element.description: Class of information to which the referencing entity applies

element.name: code
element.label: Code
element.description: Alphanumeric value identifying an instance in the namespace
element.help: alphanumeric value identifying an instance in the namespace

element.name: code
element.label: System code
element.description: Code. i.e. EPSG code.

element.name: code
element.label: Code
element.description: Value code
element.help: Value code (i.e. numeric)

element.label: Reference Authority
element.description: Authority responsible for codification. i.e. EPSG

element.label: Edition Date
element.description: Date of the edition

element.description: Formatted as 2007-09-12T15:00:00 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss)

element.name: gco:DateTime

element.name: gco:Measure
element.label: Name of Measure
element.description: Name of the test applied to the data

element.name: gco:Measure
element.label: Unit of Measure
element.description: Vertical units used for vertical extent information Examples: metres, feet, millimetres, hectopascals

element.label: Address

element.name: gmd:CI_Citation

element.name: gmd:CI_Contact

element.name: gmd:CI_Date
element.label: Date
element.description: Reference date and event used to describe it (YYYY-MM-DD)

element.name: gmd:CI_OnlineResource
element.label: OnLine resource
element.description: Information about on-line sources from which the dataset, specification, or community profile name and extended metadata elements can be obtained

element.name: gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty
element.label: Responsible party
element.description: Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organizations associated with the dataset

element.name: gmd:CI_Series
element.label: Series
element.description: Information about the series, or aggregate dataset, to which a dataset belongs

element.name: gmd:CI_Telephone
element.label: Telephone

element.name: gmd:DQ_AbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy
element.label: Absolute external positional accuracy
element.description: Closeness of reported coordinate values to values accepted as or being true

element.name: gmd:DQ_AccuracyOfATimeMeasurement
element.label: Accuracy of time measurement
element.description: Correctness of the temporal references of an item (reporting of error in time measurement)

element.name: gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission
element.label: Completeness commission
element.description: Excess data present in the dataset, as described by the scope

element.name: gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission
element.label: Completeness omission
element.description: Data absent from the dataset, as described by the scope

element.name: gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency
element.label: Conceptual consistency
element.description: Adherence to rules of the conceptual schema

element.name: gmd:DQ_ConformanceResult
element.label: Conformance result
element.description: Information about the outcome of evaluating the obtained value (or set of values) against a specified acceptable conformance quality level

element.name: gmd:DQ_DataQuality
element.label: Data quality
element.description: Quality information for the data specified by a data quality scope

element.name: gmd:DQ_DomainConsistency
element.label: Domain consistency
element.description: Adherence of values to the value domains

element.name: gmd:DQ_FormatConsistency
element.label: Format consistency
element.description: Degree to which data is stored in accordance with the physical structure of the dataset, as described by the scope

element.name: gmd:DQ_GriddedDataPositionalAccuracy
element.label: Gridded data positional accuracy
element.description: Closeness of gridded data position values to values accepted as or being true

element.name: gmd:DQ_NonQuantitativeAttributeAccuracy
element.label: Non quantitative attribute accuracy
element.description: Correctness of non-quantitative attributes

element.name: gmd:DQ_QuantitativeAttributeAccuracy
element.label: Quantitative attribute accuracy
element.description: Accuracy of quantitative attributes

element.name: gmd:DQ_QuantitativeResult
element.label: Quantitative result
element.description: The values or information about the value(s) (or set of values) obtained from applying a data quality measure

element.name: gmd:DQ_RelativeInternalPositionalAccuracy
element.label: Relative internal positional accuracy
element.description: Closeness of the relative positions of features in the scope to their respective relative positions accepted as or being true

element.name: gmd:DQ_Scope
element.label: Scope
element.description: Description of the data specified by the scope
element.help: extent of characteristic(s) of the data for which quality information is reported

element.name: gmd:DQ_TemporalConsistency
element.label: Temporal consistency
element.description: Correctness of ordered events or sequences, if reported

element.name: gmd:DQ_TemporalValidity
element.label: Temporal validity
element.description: Validity of data specified by the scope with respect to time

element.name: gmd:DQ_ThematicClassificationCorrectness
element.label: Thematic classification correctness
element.description: Comparison of the classes assigned to features or their attributes to a universe of discourse

element.name: gmd:DQ_TopologicalConsistency
element.label: Topological consistency
element.description: Correctness of the explicitly encoded topological characteristics of the dataset as described by the scope

element.name: gmd:EX_BoundingPolygon
element.label: Bounding Polygon
element.description: Boundary enclosing the dataset, expressed as the closed set of (x,y) coordinates of the polygon (last point replicates first point)

element.name: gmd:EX_Extent
element.label: Extent
element.description: Information about spatial, vertical, and temporal extent

element.name: gmd:EX_GeographicBoundingBox
element.label: Geographic bounding box
element.description: Geographic position of the dataset

element.name: gmd:EX_GeographicDescription
element.label: Geographic description
element.description: Description of the geographic area using identifiers

element.name: gmd:EX_SpatialTemporalExtent
element.label: Spatial Temporal Extent
element.description: Extent with respect to date/time and spatial boundaries

option.title: Indication that an item is incorrectly present in the data
Number of items within the dataset, that should not have been in the dataset
Number of excess items in the dataset in relation to the number of items that should have been present
Total number of exact duplications of feature instances within the data. Count of all items in the data that are incorrectly extracted with duplicate geometrie
Indicator that shows that a specific item is missing in the data
Count of all items that should have been in the dataset and are missing
Number of missing items in the dataset in relation to the number of items that should have been present
Indication that an item is not compliant to the rules of the relevant conceptual schema
Indication that an item complies with the rules of the relevant conceptual schema

option.value: Number of items noncompliant to the rules of the conceptual schema
option.title: Count of all items in the dataset that are noncompliant to the rules of the conceptual schema. If the conceptual schema explicitly or implicitly describes rules, these rules have to be followed. Violations against such rules can e.g. be invalid placement of features within a defined tolerance, duplication of features and invalid overlap of features.

helper.option: Number of items noncompliant to the rules of the conceptual schema

option.value: Number of invalid overlaps of surfaces
option.title: Total number of erroneous overlaps within the data Which surfaces may overlap and which must not is application dependent. Not all overlapping surfaces are necessarily erroneous. When reporting this data quality measure the types of feature classes corresponding to the illegal overlapping surfaces have to be reported as well.

helper.option: Number of invalid overlaps of surfaces

option.value: Non-compliance rate with respect to the rules of the conceptual schema
option.title: Number of items in the dataset that are noncompliant to the rules of the conceptual schema in relation to the total number of these items supposed to be in the dataset

helper.option: Non-compliance rate with respect to the rules of the conceptual schema

option.value: Compliance rate with the rules of the conceptual schema
option.title: number of items in the dataset in compliance with the rules of the conceptual schema in relation to the total number of items

helper.option: Compliance rate with the rules of the conceptual schema

option.title: Indication of if an item is not in conformance with its value domain
Indication of if an item is conforming to its value domain

option.value: Number of items not in conformance with their value domain
option.title: Count of all items in the dataset that are not in conformance with their value domain.

helper.option: Number of items not in conformance with their value domain

option.title: Number of items in the dataset that are in conformance with their value domain in relation to the total number of items in the dataset
the number of items in the dataset that are not in conformance with their value domain in relation to the total number of items
Count of all items in the dataset that are stored in conflict with the physical structure of the dataset
Number of items in the dataset that are stored in conflict with the physical structure of the dataset divided by the total number of items

Number of faulty point-curve connections in the dataset. A point-curve connection exists where different curves touch. These curves have an intrinsic topological relationship that has to reflect the true constellation. If the point-curve connection contradicts the universe of discourse, the point-curve connection is faulty with respect to this data quality measure. The data quality measure counts the number of errors of this kind.
Number of faulty link node connections in relation to the number of supposed link node connections

option.value: Number of missing connection due to undershoots
option.title: Count of items in the dataset, within the parameter tolerance, that are mismatched due to undershoots

helper.option: Number of missing connection due to undershoots

option.value: Number of missing connections due to overshoots
option.title: Count of items in the dataset, within the parameter tolerance, that are mismatched due to overshoots

helper.option: Number of missing connections due to overshoots

option.title: Count of all items in the dataset that are invalid sliver surfaces. A sliver is an unintended area that occurs when adjacent surfaces are not digitized properly. The borders of the adjacent surfaces may unintentionally gap or overlap by small amounts to cause a topological error.

option.value: Number of invalid self intersect errors
option.title: Count of all items in the data that illegally intersect with themselves

helper.option: Number of invalid self intersect errors

option.value: Number of invalid self overlap errors
option.title: Count of all items in the data that illegally self overlap

helper.option: Number of invalid self overlap errors
-- Positional accuracy / Absolute or external accuracy / General measures --

option.title: Mean value of the positional uncertainties for a set of positions where the positional uncertainties are defined as the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position

option.value: Mean value of positional uncertainties excluding outliers
option.title: For a set of points where the distance does not exceed a defined threshold the arithmetical average of distances between their measured positions and what is considered as the corresponding true positions

helper.option: Mean value of positional uncertainties excluding outliers

option.value: Number of positional uncertainties above a given threshold
option.title: Number of positional uncertainties above a given threshold for a set of positions. The errors are defined as the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position

helper.option: Number of positional uncertainties above a given threshold

option.value: Rate of positional errors above a given threshold
option.title: Number of positional uncertainties above a given threshold for a set of positions in relation to the total number of measured positions. The errors are defined as the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position.

helper.option: Rate of positional errors above a given threshold

option.title: A symmetrical square matrix with variances of point coordinates on the main diagonal and covariances between these coordinates as off-diagonal elements.

helper.option: -- Positional accuracy / Absolute or external accuracy / Vertical --

option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value lies with probability 50%.
Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value lies with probability 68.3%.

option.value: Linear map accuracy at 90% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value lies with probability 90%.

helper.option: Linear map accuracy at 90% significance level

option.value: Linear map accuracy at 95% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value lies with probability 95%.

helper.option: Linear map accuracy at 95% significance level

option.value: Linear map accuracy at 99% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value lies with probability 99%.

helper.option: Linear map accuracy at 99% significance level

option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value lies with probability 99.8%.
Standard deviation, where the true value is not estimated from the observations but known a priori.

option.value: Absolute linear error at 90% significance level of biased vertical data (Alternative 1)
option.title: The absolute vertical accuracy of the datas coordinates, expressed in terms of linear error at 90% probability given that a bias is present.

helper.option: Absolute linear error at 90% significance level of biased vertical data (Alternative 1)

option.value: Absolute linear error at 90% significance level of biased vertical data
option.title: The absolute vertical accuracy of the datas coordinates, expressed in terms of linear error at 90% probability given that a bias is present.

helper.option: Absolute linear error at 90% significance level of biased vertical data
-- Positional accuracy / Absolute or external accuracy / Horizontal --

option.title: Radius describing a circle, in which the true point location lies with the probability of 39.4%.
Radius describing a circle, in which the true point location lies with the probability of 50%.
Radius describing a circle, in which the true point location lies with the probability of 90%.
Radius describing a circle, in which the true point location lies with the probability of 95%.
Radius describing a circle, in which the true point location lies with the probability of 99.8%.

option.value: Root mean square error of planimetry
option.title: Radius of a circle around the given point, in which the true value lies with probability P.

helper.option: Root mean square error of planimetry

option.value: Absolute circular error at 90% significance level of biased data (Alternative 2)
option.title: The absolute horizontal accuracy of the datas coordinates, expressed in terms of circular error at 90% probability given that a bias is present.

helper.option: Absolute circular error at 90% significance level of biased data (Alternative 2)

option.value: Absolute circular error at 90% significance level of biased data
option.title: The absolute horizontal accuracy of the datas coordinates, expressed in terms of circular error at 90% probability given that a bias is present.

helper.option: Absolute circular error at 90% significance level of biased data

option.title: 2D ellipse with the two main axes indicating the direction and magnitude of the highest and the lowest uncertainty of a 2D point
2D ellipse with the two main axes indicating the direction and magnitude of the highest and the lowest uncertainty of a 2D point

helper.option: -- Positional accuracy / Relative or internal accuracy --

option.title: Evaluation of the random errors of one relief feature to another in the same dataset or on the same map/chart. It is a function of the random errors in the two elevations with respect to a common vertical datum.
Evaluation of the random errors in the horizontal position of one feature to another in the same dataset or on the same map/chart.

helper.option: -- Temporal accuracy / Accuracy of a time measurement --

option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the time instance lies with probability 68.3%.
Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the time instance lies with probability 50%.
Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the time instance lies with probability 90%.
Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the time instance lies with probability 95%.
Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the time instance lies with probability 99%.
Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the time instance lies with probability 99.8%.
Number of incorrectly classified features
number of incorrectly classified features in relation to the number of features that are supposed to be there
matrix that indicates the number of items of class (i) classified as class (j).
matrix that indicates the number of items of class (i) classified as class (i) divided by the number of items of class (i)
Coefficient to quantify the proportion of agreement of assignments to classes by removing misclassifications
Total number of erroneous attribute values within the relevant part of the dataset
Number of correct attribute values in relation to the total number of attribute values
Number of attribute values where incorrect values are assigned in relation to the total number of attribute values

option.value: Attribute value uncertainty at 68.3% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the quantitative attribute lies with probability 68.3%.

helper.option: Attribute value uncertainty at 68.3% significance level

option.value: Attribute value uncertainty at 50% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the quantitative attribute lies with probability 50%.

helper.option: Attribute value uncertainty at 50% significance level

option.value: Attribute value uncertainty at 90% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the quantitative attribute lies with probability 90%.

helper.option: Attribute value uncertainty at 90% significance level

option.value: Attribute value uncertainty at 95% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the quantitative attribute lies with probability 95%.

helper.option: Attribute value uncertainty at 95% significance level

option.value: Attribute value uncertainty at 99% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the quantitative attribute lies with probability 99%.

helper.option: Attribute value uncertainty at 99% significance level

option.value: Attribute value uncertainty at 99.8% significance level
option.title: Half length of the interval defined by an upper and a lower limit, in which the true value for the quantitative attribute lies with probability 99.8%.

element.name: gmd:useLimitation

element.label: User defined maintenance frequency
element.description: Maintenance period other than those defined

element.name: gmd:userDeterminedLimitations

element.description: Applications, determined by the user for which the resource and/or resource series is not suitable

element.name: gmd:userNote
element.label: User note
element.description: Explanation of the application of the legal constraints or other restrictions and legal prerequisites for obtaining and using the resource or metadata

element.name: gmd:value

element.description: Quantitative value or values, content determined by the evaluation procedure used

element.name: gmd:value
element.label: Value
element.description: Data type value

element.name: gmd:valueUnit

element.name: gmd:voice

element.name: gmd:volumes

element.description: Number of items in the media identified

element.name: gmd:westBoundLongitude
element.label: West bound
element.description: Western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent, expressed in longitude in decimal degrees (positive east)

element.name: gml:beginPosition
element.label: Begin date
element.description: Formatted as 2007-09-12T15:00:00 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss)

element.name: gml:endPosition
element.label: End date
element.description: Formatted as 2007-09-12T15:00:00 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss)

element.name: gml:relatedTime
element.label: Related time
element.description: Defines the relation of a given time to the object.

element.name: gml:coordinates
element.label: Coordinates
element.description: Used to record an array of tuples or coordinates.

element.name: gml:Polygon
element.label: Polygon
element.description: A gml:Polygon is a special surface that is defined by a single surface patch. The boundary of this patch is coplanar and the polygon uses planar interpolation in its interior.

element.name: gml:Point
element.label: Point
element.description: A gml:Point is defined by a single coordinate tuple.

element.name: gml:LineString
element.label: Line
element.description: A gml:LineString is a special curve that consists of a single segment with linear interpolation. It is defined by two or more coordinate tuples, with linear interpolation between them.

element.name: gml:LinearRing
element.label: Linear ring
element.description: A gml:LinearRing is defined by four or more coordinate tuples, with linear interpolation between them; the first and last coordinates shall be coincident.

element.name: gml:exterior
element.label: Outer boundary
element.description: The outer boundary of a solid.

element.name: gml:interior
element.label: Inner boundary
element.description: The inner boundary of a solid

element.name: gml:duration
element.label: Duration
element.description: Conforms to the ISO 8601 syntax for temporal length as implemented by the XML Schema duration type.

element.name: gml:timeInterval
element.label: Time interval
element.description: conforms to ISO 11404 which is based on floating point values for temporal length. ISO 11404 syntax specifies the use of a positiveInteger together with appropriate values for radix and factor. The resolution of the time interval is to one radix ^(-factor) of the specified time unit. The value of the unit is either selected from the units for time intervals from ISO 31-1:1992, or is another suitable unit. The encoding is defined for GML in gml:TimeUnitType. The second component of this union type provides a method for indicating time units other than the six standard units given in the enumeration.

element.name: gts:TM_PeriodDuration
element.label: Period duration
element.description:
The duration data type is used to specify a time interval.
The time interval is specified in the following form "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" where:
* P indicates the period (required) * nY indicates the number of years * nM indicates the number of months * nD indicates the number of days * T indicates the start of a time section (required if you are going to specify hours, minutes, or seconds) * nH indicates the number of hours * nM indicates the number of minutes * nS indicates the number of seconds

entry.label: Voice
entry.description: Telephone provides voice service

entry.label: Facsimilie
entry.description: Telephone provides facsimilie service

entry.label: SMS
entry.description: Telephone provides sms service

entry.label: Creation
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was brought into existence

entry.label: Publication
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was issued

entry.label: Revision
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and improved or amended

entry.label: Expiry
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource expires

entry.label: LastUpdate
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was last updated

entry.label: LastReview
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was last reviewed

entry.label: NextUpdate
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource will be next updated

entry.label: NotAvailable
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource became not available or obtainable

entry.label: InForce
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource became in force

entry.label: Adopted
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was adopted

entry.label: Deprecated
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was deprecated

entry.label: Superseded
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource was superseded or replaced by another resource

entry.label: ValidityBegins
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource is considered to be valid

entry.label: ValidityExpires
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource is no longer considered to be valid

entry.label: Released
entry.description: Date identifies when the resource shall be released for public access

entry.label: Distribution
entry.description: Date identifies when an instance of the resource was distributed

entry.label: Download
entry.description: Online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another

entry.label: Information
entry.description: Online information about the resource

entry.label: Offline access
entry.description: Online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider

entry.label: Order
entry.description: Online order process for obtening the resource

entry.label: Search
entry.description: Online search interface for seeking out information about the resource

entry.label: CompleteMetadata
entry.description: Complete metadata provided

entry.label: BrowseGraphic
entry.description: Browse Graphic provided

entry.label: Upload
entry.description: Upload service provided

entry.label: EmailService
entry.description: Email service provided

entry.label: Browsing
entry.description: Online browsing provided

entry.label: FileAccess
entry.description: Online file access provided

entry.label: Digital document
entry.description: Digital representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also)

entry.label: Digital image
entry.description: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and stored in digital format

entry.label: Hardcopy document
entry.description: Representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also) on paper, photograhic material, or other media

entry.label: Hardcopy image
entry.description: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: Digital map
entry.description: Map represented in raster or vector form

entry.label: Hardcopy map
entry.description: Map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: Digital model
entry.description: Multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.

entry.label: Hardcopy model
entry.description: 3-dimensional, physical model

entry.label: Digital profile
entry.description: Vertical cross-section in digital form

entry.label: Hardcopy profile
entry.description: Vertical cross-section printed on paper, etc.

entry.label: Digital table
entry.description: Digital representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns

entry.label: Hardcopy table
entry.description: Representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed onpapers, photographic material, or other media

entry.label: Digital video
entry.description: Digital video recording

entry.label: Hardcopy video
entry.description: Video recording on film

entry.label: Digital audio
entry.description: Digital audio recording

entry.label: Hardcopy audio
entry.description: Audio recording delivered by analog media, such as magnetic tape

entry.label: Multimedia digital
entry.description: Information representation using simultaneously various digital modes for text, sound and image

entry.label: Multimedia hardcopy
entry.description: Information representation using simultaneously various analog modes for text, sound and image

entry.label: Physical object
entry.description: A physical object eg. rock or mineral sample, microscope slide

entry.label: Digital diagram
entry.description: Information represented graphically by charts such as pie chart, bar chart and other type of diagrams and recorded in digital format

entry.label: Hardcopy diagram
entry.description: Information represented graphically by charts such as pie chart, bar chart and other type of diagrams and printed on paper, photographic material, or other media

entry.label: Resource provider
entry.description: Party that supplies the resource

entry.label: Custodian
entry.description: Party that accepts accountability and responsability for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource

entry.label: Owner
entry.description: Party that owns the resource

entry.label: User
entry.description: Party who uses the resource

entry.label: Distributor
entry.description: Party who distributes the resource

entry.label: Originator
entry.description: Party who created the resource

entry.label: Point of contact
entry.description: Party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource

entry.label: Principal investigator
entry.description: Key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research

entry.label: Processor
entry.description: Party wha has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified

entry.label: Publisher
entry.description: Party who published the resource

entry.label: Author
entry.description: Party who authored the resource

entry.label: Sponsor
entry.description: Party who speaks for the resource

entry.label: Co-author
entry.description: Party who jointly authors the resource

entry.label: Collaborator
entry.description: Party who assists with the generation of the resource other than the principal investigator

entry.label: Editor
entry.description: Party who reviewed or modified the resource to improve the content

entry.label: Mediator
entry.description: A class of entity that mediates access to the resource and for whom the resource is intended or useful

entry.label: Rights holder
entry.description: Party owning or managing rights over the resource

entry.label: Contributor
entry.description: Party contributing to the resource

entry.label: Funder
entry.description: Party providing monetary support for the resource

entry.label: Stakeholder
entry.description: Party who has an interest in the resource or the use of the resource

entry.label: Direct internal
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where all data required is internal to the dataset being evaluated

entry.label: Direct external
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where reference data external to the dataset being evaluated is required

entry.label: Indirect
entry.description: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on external knowledge

entry.label: Cross reference
entry.description: Reference from one dataset to another

entry.label: Larger work citation
entry.description: Reference to a master dataset of which this one is a part

entry.label: Part of seamless database
entry.description: Part of the same structured set of data held in a computer

entry.label: Source
entry.description: Mapping and charting information from which the dataset content originates

entry.label: Stereo mate
entry.description: Part of a set of imagery that when used together, provides three-dimensional images

entry.label: Is composed of
entry.description: Reference to resources that are parts of this resource

entry.label: Collective Title
entry.description: Common title for a collection of resources. NOTE Title identifies elements of a series collectively, combined with information about what volumes are available at the source cite

entry.label: Series
entry.description: Associated through a common heritage such as produced to a common product specification

entry.label: Dependency
entry.description: Associated through a dependency

entry.label: Revision Of
entry.description: Resource is a revision of associated resource

entry.label: Campaign
entry.description: Series of organized planned actions

entry.label: Collection
entry.description: Accumulation of datasets assembled for a specific purpose

entry.label: Exercise
entry.description: Specific performance of a function or group of functions

entry.label: Experiment
entry.description: Process designed to find if something is effective or valid

entry.label: Investigation
entry.description: Search or systematic inquiry

entry.label: Mission
entry.description: Specific operation of a data collection system

entry.label: Sensor
entry.description: Device or piece of equipment which detects or records

entry.label: Operation
entry.description: Action that is part of a series of actions

entry.label: Platform
entry.description: Vehicle or other support base that holds a sensor

entry.label: Process
entry.description: Method of doing something involving a number of steps

entry.label: Program
entry.description: Specific planned activity

entry.label: Project
entry.description: Organized undertaking, research, or development

entry.label: Study
entry.description: Examination or investigation

entry.label: Task
entry.description: Piece of work

entry.label: Trial
entry.description: Process of testing to discover or demonstrate something

entry.label: Compound Engineering Parametric
entry.description: Compound spatio-parametric coordinate reference system containing an engineering coordinate reference system and a parametric reference system EXAMPLE: [local] x, y, pressure

entry.label: Compound Engineering Parametric Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-parametric-temporal coordinate reference system containing an engineering, a parametric, and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: [local] x, y, pressure, time

entry.label: Compound Engineering Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-temporal coordinate reference system containing an engineering and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: [local] x, y, time

entry.label: Compound Engineering Vertical
entry.description: Compound spatial reference system containing a horizontal engineering coordinate reference system and a vertical coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: [local] x, y, height

entry.label: Compound Engineering Vertical Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-temporal coordinate reference system containing an engineering, a vertical, and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: [local] x, y, height, time

entry.label: Compound Geographic 2D Parametric
entry.description: Compound spatio-parametric coordinate reference system containing a 2 dimensional geographic horizontal coordinate reference system and a parametric reference system EXAMPLE: latitude, longitude, pressure

entry.label: Compound Geographic 2D Parametric Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-parametric-temporal coordinate reference system containing a 2 dimensional geographic horizontal, a parametric and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: latitude, longitude, pressure, time

entry.label: Compound Geographic 2D Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-temporal coordinate reference system containing a 2 dimensional geographic horizontal coordinate reference system and a temporal reference system EXAMPLE: latitude, longitude, time

entry.label: Compound Geographic 2D Vertical
entry.description: Compound coordinate reference system in which one constituent coordinate reference system is a horizontal geodetic coordinate reference system and one is a vertical coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: latitude, longitude, [gravity-related] height or depth

entry.label: Compound Geographic 2D Vertical Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-temporal coordinate reference system containing a 2 dimensional geographic horizontal, a vertical, and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: latitude, longitude, height, time

entry.label: Compound Geographic 3D Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-temporal coordinate reference system containing a 3 dimensional geographic and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE latitude, longitude, ellipsoidal height, time

entry.label: Compound Projected 2D Parametric
entry.description: Compound spatio-parametric coordinate reference system containing a projected horizontal coordinate reference system and a parametric reference system EXAMPLE: easting, northing, density

entry.label: Compound Projected 2D Parametric Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-parametric-temporal coordinate reference system containing a projected horizontal, a parametric, and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: easting, northing, density, time

entry.label: Compound Projected Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-temporal coordinate reference system containing a projected horizontal and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: easting, northing, time

entry.label: Compound Projected Vertical
entry.description: Compound spatial reference system containing a horizontal projected coordinate reference system and a vertical coordinate reference system EXAMPLE easting, northing, [gravity-related] height or depth

entry.label: Compound Projected Vertical Temporal
entry.description: Compound spatio-temporal coordinate reference system containing a projected horizontal, a vertical, and a temporal coordinate reference system EXAMPLE: easting, northing, height, time

entry.label: Engineering
entry.description: Coordinate reference system based on an engineering datum (datum describing the relationship of a coordinate system to a local reference) EXAMPLE: [local] x,y

entry.label: Engineering Design
entry.description: Engineering coordinate reference system in which the base representation of a moving object is specified EXAMPLE: [local] x,y

entry.label: Engineering Image
entry.description: Coordinate reference system based on an image datum (engineering datum which defines the relationship of a coordinate system to an image) EXAMPLE: row, column

entry.label: Geodetic Geocentric
entry.description: Geodetic CRS having a Cartesian 3D coordinate system EXAMPLE: [geocentric] X,Y,Z

entry.label: Geodetic Geographic 2D
entry.description: Geodetic CRS having an ellipsoidal 2D coordinate system EXAMPLE: latitude, longitude

entry.label: Geodetic Geographic 3D
entry.description: Geodetic CRS having an ellipsoidal 3D coordinate system EXAMPLE: latitude, longitude, ellipsoidal height

entry.label: Geographic Identifier
entry.description: Spatial reference in the form of a label or code that identifies a location EXAMPLE: post code

entry.label: Linear
entry.description: Reference system that identifies a location by reference to a segment of a linear geographic feature and distance along that segment from a given point EXAMPLE: x km along road

entry.label: Parametric
entry.description: Coordinate reference system based on a parametric datum (datum describing the relationship of a parametric coordinate system to an object) EXAMPLE: pressure

entry.label: Projected
entry.description: Coordinate reference system derived from a two-dimensional geodetic coordinate reference system by applying a map projection EXAMPLE: easting, northing

entry.label: Temporal
entry.description: Reference system against which time is measured EXAMPLE: time

entry.label: Vertical
entry.description: One-dimensional coordinate reference system based on a vertical datum (datum describing the relation of gravity-related heights or depths to the Earth) EXAMPLE: [gravity-related] height or depth

entry.label: Point
entry.description: Each cell represents a point

entry.label: Area
entry.description: Each cell represents an area

entry.label: Voxel
entry.description: Each cell represents a volumetric measurement on a regular grid in three dimensional space

entry.label: Stratum
entry.description: Height range for a single point vertical profile

entry.label: UCS2
entry.description: 16-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UCS4
entry.description: 32-bit fixed size Universal Character Set, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF7
entry.description: 7-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF8
entry.description: 8-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: UTF16
entry.description: 16-bit variable size UCS Transfer Format, based on ISO/IEC 10646

entry.label: 8859 Part 1
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-1, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 1 : Latin alphabet No.1

entry.label: 8859 Part 2
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-2, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 2 : Latin alphabet No.2

entry.label: 8859 Part 3
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-3, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 3 : Latin alphabet No.3

entry.label: 8859 Part 4
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-4, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 4 : Latin alphabet No.4

entry.label: 8859 Part 5
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-5, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 5 : Latin/Cyrillic alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 6
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-6, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 6 : Latin/Arabic alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 7
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-7, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 7 : Latin/Greek alphabet

entry.label: 8859 Part 8
entry.description: ISO/IEC 8859-8, Information technology - 8-bit single byte coded graphic character sets - Part 8 : Latin/Hebrew alphabet
